result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:02 PM Defendant Thomas N. Matke in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court for Thomas N. Matke. 
ADA Jambois calls witness, Officer Long, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Cross exam by Atty Bergner.
Exhibit P#1, 2, 3, & 4 are marked and referred to during cross exam for the officer to refresh his memory.
Redirect by ADA Jambois.
ADA Jamois moves to enter exhibits into evidence.
BY THE COURT: Exhibits 1, 2, 3 & 4 are admitted into evidence.
Attorney arguments are heard.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Letter from the Defendant dated 02/28/22 in re:  request for wage assignment (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 03/01/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:32 PM Defendant Thomas N. Matke appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant indicates he has not applied thru the public defender yet.  A public defender was present at the last hearing.  He was supposed to have Eric Sheets but it's hard to contact him. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

No contact with L.B. or her residence 
Comply with any other bond that he is currently under

1:28 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor, Disorderly Conduct - Domestic and Possible Possession of THC.
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner objects to the State's request for a $1,500 cash bond and states his objections on the record and informs 
the Court that the defendant is indigent.
Court believes that some cash is necessary and will set a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  February 28, 2022  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
